summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and for perjury in connection with 2016 depositions. It details the allegations of her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of girls as young as 14 from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sex acts and perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing minor victims with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell conspired to sexually abuse minor girls. The press release details their joint scheme to recruit, groom, and abuse victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's disregard for the law.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and law enforcement partners for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls. Maxwell facilitated and participated in Epstein's abuse.
Maxwell is alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor girls to be sexually abused by Epstein and, in some cases, by herself.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused the minor girls recruited and groomed by Maxwell.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14.

events.title: Maxwell's Sworn Depositions
events.description: Maxwell testified under oath in a civil proceeding and allegedly made repeated false statements about specific acts and events related to the abuse.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Maxwell was arrested and an indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts and perjury.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, specifically for acts between 1994 and 1997.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of girls as young as 14, including being present for sex acts.
Maxwell is also charged with perjury for false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions in a civil proceeding.
The alleged abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein residences (NY, FL, NM) and at Maxwell's residence in London.
The case is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and is assigned to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
